description: Founding Director of the Center for Open Neuroscience. Research Professor of Psychological and Brain Sciences and Adjunct Professor of Computer Science at Dartmouth College. Official Debian Developer and open source contributor leading DANDI, DataLad, PyMVPA, and NeuroDebian projects. Serves on BIDS and NWB technical advisory committees.

Co-Director of the Center for Open Neuroscience at Dartmouth College. Formerly directed Dartmouth Brain Imaging Center and Center for Cognitive Neuroscience. Recognized for developing and disseminating open research methodologies and influential datasets.
Software Developer at the Center for Open Neuroscience. Python and open-source enthusiast. Works on DataLad-Registry and DANDI metadata-related initiatives.
Software Engineer at the Center for Open Neuroscience, Dartmouth College. Passionate about open source values and developing inclusive, transparent open science tools.
Software Engineer and Consultant at the Center for Open Neuroscience. Working on ReproStim, ReproMon, con/noisseur, and event collection/timing projects.

Research Software Engineer at the Center for Open Neuroscience. Data specialist creating NWB and DANDI ecosystem software packages (NeuroConv, NWB Inspector, NWB GUIDE). Experienced uploading hundreds of terabytes to NIH archives.
Ph.D. Student at INM-7, Research Centre Jülich, Germany. Lead of the DataLad Handbook. Clinical Psychology background pursuing open science and open software.
Collaborator at the Center for Open Neuroscience. Affiliated with UMass Chan Medical School. The master-mind of the ReproNim project.
Collaborator at the Center for Open Neuroscience. Affiliated with McGill University, Canada.
Independent collaborator at the Center for Open Neuroscience. Core Debian distribution contributor (debhelper, debian-installer, debconf, pristine-tar). Developer of git-annex used in DataLad.
Collaborator at the Center for Open Neuroscience. Affiliated with University of Texas, Austin. Director and founder of brainlife.io cloud computing platform.

Collaborator at the Center for Open Neuroscience. J.-Prof. at INM-7, Research Centre Jülich, Germany and University of Magdeburg. Official Debian developer. Lead of PyMVPA, NeuroDebian, DataLad projects.
Collaborator at the Center for Open Neuroscience. Affiliated with MIT and Harvard Medical School. Lead of DANDI, NiPype, and other projects.
Associate Professor of Psychological and Brain Sciences at Dartmouth College. Director of the Contextual Dynamics Lab.

Associate Professor of Psychological and Brain Sciences at Dartmouth College. Director of the Computational Social and Affective Neuroscience Lab. Develops tools studying computational processes underlying emotions, social interactions, and neurobiological substrates.
Associate Professor of Psychological and Brain Sciences at Dartmouth College. Studies how neural ensembles across brain areas organize experience for adaptive behavior.

Professor at Dartmouth College. Director of Dartmouth Brain Imaging Center and Center for Cognitive Neuroscience. Dedicated to developing functional neuroimaging analysis methods and sharing tools and data with the community.
Emeritus member of the Center for Open Neuroscience. Formerly Dartmouth Ph.D. student, now at UC Berkeley. Cognitive Neuroscience Ph.D. DueCredit co-developer.
Emeritus member of the Center for Open Neuroscience. ReproMan and DataLad contributor. Git expert and Magit authority.
Emeritus member of the Center for Open Neuroscience. Affiliated with INM-7, Research Centre Jülich. DataLad project contributor.
Emeritus Software Developer at the Center for Open Neuroscience. DANDI client developer. Skilled in Python, Rust, DevOps, testing, packaging, type-hinting, and CI.
Emeritus Research Scientist at the Center for Open Neuroscience. DANDI contributor. Skilled in Python, neuroimaging, and psychopharmacology.
Emeritus member of the Center for Open Neuroscience. Research Software Engineer at Stanford University. Singularity Hub developer.
Emeritus member of the Center for Open Neuroscience. Formerly Dartmouth Ph.D. student, now at Princeton. Cognitive Neuroscience Ph.D. PyMVPA user and NeuroDebian exhibitor.
Emeritus member of the Center for Open Neuroscience. Affiliated with University of Birmingham. Neurologist and neuroimaging methods expert. Neuroimaging in Python lead and NiPy/NiBabel developer.
Emeritus member of the Center for Open Neuroscience. Pythonista. DataLad project contributor.
Emeritus member of the Center for Open Neuroscience. CS undergraduate at Barnard College, Columbia University. 2016 DataLad developer intern.
Emeritus member of the Center for Open Neuroscience. Masters student in Psychology/Cognitive Neuroscience at University of Magdeburg.
Emeritus member of the Center for Open Neuroscience. Ph.D. in Psychology with Masters in Computer Science, Cognitive Science, and Philosophy. PyMVPA developer and NeuroDebian promoter.
Emeritus member of the Center for Open Neuroscience. Dartmouth undergraduate passionate about neuroimaging and open science. NiBabel contributor. ReproNim training editor.
Emeritus member of the Center for Open Neuroscience. Software engineer at Indiana University, Bloomington, working on brainlife.io.
